intro: Hoffmannia inamoena, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Hoffmannia inamoena is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
